cyclone.name: ANA
cyclone.current_location: about 165 mi SSE of Myrtle Beach, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift north-northwest toward the South Carolina coast this weekend, then curve northeast and parallel the Mid-Atlantic coast before moving out to sea south of New England
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the coast between Myrtle Beach, SC and Cape Fear, NC

weather_observation.watch_coast: Edisto Beach SC to south of South Santee River SC
weather_observation.warning_coast: South Santee River SC to Cape Lookout NC
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Coastline from South Carolina through North Carolina, with later impacts spreading northward along the Mid-Atlantic and New England coasts
weather_observation.wind: Gusty easterly winds could reach 25–35 mph (below gale strength) Monday as Ana’s remnants pass southeast of the Chesapeake.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor tidal departures (<1 ft) possible in upper Chesapeake Bay; significant surge not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of rain Monday–Monday night, generally 1–2 inches with locally higher amounts.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Increased rip-current risk at nearby Atlantic beaches; slight coastal flooding at high tide.
